category_system.description: Japanese profanity categorization system adapted for cultural context
category_system.methodology: Based on Japanese social hierarchy, directness taboos, and internet culture

general.name: 一般的な悪口 (General Profanity)
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration
general.cultural_context: Less tolerance for direct confrontation than Western cultures

insult.name: 侮辱語 (Personal Insults)
insult.description: Direct personal attacks and derogatory terms for individuals
insult.cultural_context: Direct insults are particularly harsh in Japanese culture due to face-saving importance

subcategories.intelligence: Attacks on mental capacity (baka, aho, hakuchi)

sexual.name: 性的な言葉 (Sexual Content)
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content
sexual.cultural_context: Sexual content is heavily taboo in formal Japanese society

violence.name: 暴力的な言葉 (Violence and Threats)
violence.description: Words promoting violence, threats, or aggressive behavior
violence.cultural_context: Violence threats taken extremely seriously in Japanese society

hate_speech.name: ヘイトスピーチ (Hate Speech)
hate_speech.description: Language targeting individuals or groups based on identity
hate_speech.cultural_context: Strong sensitivity to ethnic discrimination due to historical issues

subcategories.ethnic: Ethnic slurs (chon, shina, chousenjin when derogatory)

appearance.name: 外見への悪口 (Appearance-based Insults)
appearance.cultural_context: Physical appearance comments are particularly hurtful in image-conscious Japanese society

lgbtq.name: LGBTQ関連 (LGBTQ-related Terms)
lgbtq.description: Terms related to sexual orientation and gender identity
lgbtq.cultural_context: Traditional Japanese society less accepting, but changing

scatological.name: スカトロジー (Scatological References)
scatological.description: References to bodily waste and bathroom functions
scatological.examples_note: Toilet humor and bodily function references
scatological.cultural_context: Bathroom topics are taboo in formal Japanese conversation

body_parts.name: 身体部位 (Body Parts)
body_parts.description: Crude references to body parts, especially sexual organs
body_parts.cultural_context: Body part references are highly inappropriate in Japanese formal context

age.name: 年齢差別 (Age Discrimination)
age.cultural_context: Respect for age is traditional, but generational tensions exist

internet_slang.name: ネットスラング (Internet Slang)
internet_slang.examples_note: Internet culture terminology, not necessarily offensive
internet_slang.cultural_context: 2ch/5ch culture has created unique linguistic expressions

religious.name: 宗教的冒涜 (Religious Profanity)
religious.description: Terms related to Buddhist/Shinto religious concepts used inappropriately
religious.cultural_context: Buddhist concepts often secularized, less offensive than Christian blasphemy

generational.name: 世代論 (Generational Discrimination)
generational.description: Discrimination based on generational membership or characteristics
generational.cultural_context: Japan has strong generational identity and associated stereotypes

disability.name: 障害者差別 (Disability Discrimination)
disability.description: Terms discriminating against people with disabilities
disability.cultural_context: Disability discrimination heavily stigmatized, mental health especially sensitive

1.description: Casual rudeness, acceptable among friends but inappropriate in formal settings
1.cultural_note: Still more serious than Western equivalent due to directness taboo

2.description: Clearly inappropriate, would cause social discomfort in most settings
2.cultural_note: Violates social harmony, requires apology if used inappropriately

3.description: Highly offensive, could damage relationships and social standing
3.cultural_note: Serious face-loss for both speaker and target, may require formal apology

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, causing significant social harm
4.cultural_note: Could result in social ostracism, legal consequences, or violence

formality_levels.casual: Acceptable among close friends in private
formality_levels.casual_insult: Mild teasing among friends, inappropriate elsewhere
formality_levels.potentially_offensive: Context-dependent, could be neutral or offensive
formality_levels.extremely_discriminatory: Severe discrimination with potential legal implications

cultural_considerations.keigo_violations: Failure to use appropriate honorific language can be offensive
cultural_considerations.directness_taboo: Direct confrontation is more offensive than in Western cultures
cultural_considerations.group_harmony: Disrupting wa (group harmony) is particularly serious
cultural_considerations.face_saving: Causing loss of face (mentsu) has severe social consequences
cultural_considerations.context_dependency: Same word can range from playful to offensive based on relationship and setting
cultural_considerations.generational_differences: Older generations may find certain terms more offensive
cultural_considerations.regional_variations: Kansai vs Tokyo differences in acceptable language
cultural_considerations.media_influence: Anime/manga exposure has changed perception of some terms internationally
